$interpreted: Izumi: Woah, that scared me~Perfect timing, I need a workout to let off some steam anyway~
Uzziah: ...This spell...
Uzziah: I remember this technique. Even among the different religious sections, this is not a universal technique among all Immortals.
Uzziah: I see...so it's you. You've taken on the appearance of a fox demihuman this time. What is your purpose?
Izumi: My, my, I was wondering who this bumbling idiot is. Turns out enemies do end up closer to you than friends~ As to my purpose... I~ Won't~ Tell~ you~
Uzziah: You don't have such a choice!

Izumi: Yikes~ We haven't seen each other for so long~
Yet you still favor that clunky "Ganging up on people with big numbers" tactic.
Izumi: Don't you get tired of it?
Uzziah: Despite your immense knowledge, a physical form means your body still has its limits. As long as you remain "alive", you're no match for me.
Uzziah: For those who refuse to give up their greed for life, this is the price they have to pay.
Izumi: ...I wonder who's the one that can't give up their greed for life...
Uzziah: What do you mean?
Izumi: It means that a wise man would not fight a losing battle~
Izumi: Bye bye, young fella~
Uzziah: ...In your dreams. No matter how many people I have to sacrifice, I'm going to make sure that your life ends right here, right now!
Uzziah: Because this...is the mission I was entrusted with!
Izumi: Nigel, we're surrounded by monsters!
Nigel: WHAT!?
Izumi: I just returned from outside the castle. The monsters that were originally in separate bunches suddenly gather up outside the castle!
Izumi: We're not sure why! Take a look outside the window!
Subordinate: It's true! Those monsters were right on Izumi's tail. If not for our help, Izumi would not have made it into the castle in time.
Nigel: Gather every single person that is in the castle right now, including outsiders. Make haste!
Yamitsuki: This is too abnormal. I've never seen such a movement pattern from the monsters...
Naya: No, I've seen similar situations back when I was still stationed at Paradise Prairie.
Naya: The monsters were manipulated by a mysterious figure. Not only do they come together, they even act according to his commands!
Nigel: Are you saying that these monsters we're seeing right now are manipulated as well?
Angelia: For now, let's disregard the question of who's manipulating them. If that massive horde heads straight for this location...
Nigel: As much as I don't want to admit it...we won't stand a chance.
Naya: Then what should we do? Run away from here?
Nigel: Out of the question! I will not abandon my own home!
Naya: Idiot! What's the point of having a home if you can't stay alive!
Izumi: Welp~ I don't know, but I think it's kind of romantic to die in your own home~
Yamitsuki: Shut it!
Izumi: Ohh~ So scary~ Guess I'll shut up. Too bad, I just thought of this really amazing idea~
Nigel: Yamitsuki, wait! Let him speak! Izumi, what do you want to say?
Izumi: Hehe, my plan involves using the Rayzor.
Izumi: What do you think? A pretty amazing plan, isn't it~
Angelia: Use the Rayzor to blast away the monster horde at our doorsteps?
Elio: If we act fast, this method might just work out.
Naya: But if we want to power up the Rayzor, wouldn't we need a very large amount of Soul Energy?
Nigel: Yamitsuki and I will take a trip to the Dragoneye Gem. We will set up a rune device to teleport the Soul Energy back here.
Angelia: Naya and I will be providing assistance to Sir Sherlock.
Angelia: Let's reboot the Rayzor together!
Naya: That tin can...I hope he is not a fast worker and the core hasn't been removed yet...
Nigel: Angelia, you will be in charge of firing the weapon. I'll assign several subordinates to escort you to the control room.
Angelia: Thank you. Everybody, let's get moving. Time is scarce!
Nigel: Bastards, are they trying to stop us?
Nigel: Are you alright?
Yamitsuki: ...I'm fine.
Nigel: Good, then hurry. We don't have much time left!
Nigel: This is it.
Nigel: Out of my way!!

Yamitsuki: ...The rune device is set up. The Soul Energy should be able to make its way back to the castle. 
It's now all up to them to complete the task.
Nigel: Damn it...we better make it...
